Dishes.Name: Chilaquiles
Recipe: 1. Cut the tortillas into small strips and fry them until crispy.
2. In a separate pan, heat the red or green sauce (depending on your preference).
3. Add the crispy tortilla strips to the sauce and cook for a few minutes until they soften.
4. Shred cooked chicken and add it to the chilaquiles, mixing it well.
5. Serve with a sprinkle of cheese, onion, cilantro, and a dollop of sour cream.
6. Optionally, top with a fried egg and avocado slices.

Dishes.Name: Tacos
Ingredients: Choice of meat (beef, pork, chicken, or vegetarian options)
Recipe: 1. Cook the meat of your choice (grill, saut√©, or slow-cook until tender).
2. Heat the tortillas on a comal or skillet.
3. Once the meat is ready, slice it into small pieces or shred it (depending on the type of meat).
4. Serve the meat in the warm tortillas.
5. Top with freshly chopped onion, cilantro, a squeeze of lime, and your favorite salsa.
6. Add hot sauce for an extra kick.

Dishes.Name: Sopes
Recipe: 1. Make small thick tortillas from the corn masa.
2. Heat them on a griddle until lightly golden.
3. Use your fingers to pinch the edges of the tortilla, creating a small border to hold the toppings.
4. Spread a layer of refried beans over the tortilla.
5. Top with shredded lettuce, crumbled queso fresco, sour cream, and salsa.
6. Optionally, add sliced onion for extra flavor.

Dishes.Name: Enchiladas
Recipe: 1. Heat the tortillas in a pan to soften them.
2. Shred the cooked chicken and place a spoonful in the center of each tortilla.
3. Roll the tortillas around the chicken and place them in a baking dish.
4. Pour the red or green enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas.
5. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve with sour cream, chopped onion, and fresh cilantro on top.

Dishes.Name: Pozole
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, cook the hominy corn with pork or chicken, garlic, and onion.
2. Simmer for several hours until the meat is tender and the flavors are well combined.
3. Prepare toppings: thinly slice cabbage, radishes, and lime.
4. Serve the pozole in bowls and garnish with cabbage, radishes, oregano, and a squeeze of lime.
5. Optionally, add chili powder for extra spice.

Dishes.Name: Tamales
Recipe: 1. Soak the corn husks in warm water to soften.
2. Prepare the masa by mixing it with chicken broth, baking powder, salt, and lard (or butter).
3. Add your choice of meat and sauce to the masa.
4. Spread a thin layer of masa on each corn husk, then fold it into a small packet.
5. Steam the tamales in a large pot for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the masa is fully cooked.

Dishes.Name: Mole Poblano
Recipe: 1. Cook the chicken until tender.
2. Heat the mole sauce in a separate pot, adjusting the consistency with water or chicken broth as needed.
3. Once the chicken is cooked, pour the mole sauce over it and simmer for about 10-15 minutes.
4. Serve with a side of rice and garnish with sesame seeds.

Dishes.Name: Cochinita Pibil
Recipe: 1. Marinate the pork with annatto paste, citrus juice, garlic, salt, and pepper for at least 4 hours (overnight is best).
2. Wrap the marinated pork in banana leaves and bake it in a low oven (around 300¬∞F or 150¬∞C) for about 3-4 hours, or until the pork is tender and shreds easily.
3. Serve with pickled red onions and warm tortillas.

Dishes.Name: Tlayudas
Recipe: 1. Grill the large tortilla until crispy.
2. Top with Oaxacan cheese and cook until melted.
3. Add the meat (grilled or saut√©ed) and lettuce.
4. Serve with salsa and avocado if desired.

Dishes.Name: Chiles en Nogada
Recipe: 1. Roast the poblano chiles and peel them.
2. Prepare the filling by cooking ground meat and adding fruits (chopped apples, plantains, and peaches).
3. Prepare the walnut sauce by blending walnuts with milk and cinnamon until smooth.
4. Stuff the chiles with the meat and fruit mixture, then cover with the walnut sauce.
5. Garnish with pomegranate seeds and cilantro.

Dishes.Name: Enfrijoladas
Recipe: 1. Heat the black beans until soft and blend into a smooth sauce.
2. Dip the tortillas into the bean sauce and roll them up.
3. Serve with chopped onions, cheese, sour cream, and a drizzle of salsa.

Dishes.Name: Quesadillas
Ingredients: Cheese (queso fresco, Oaxaca, or other melting cheese)
Recipe: 1. Heat a tortilla in a skillet.
2. Add cheese (and optional meat) on top.
3. Fold the tortilla in half and grill until crispy and golden.
4. Serve with salsa and hot sauce.

Dishes.Name: Gorditas
Recipe: 1. Form thick tortillas from the masa.
2. Cook them on a griddle until golden.
3. Cut them in half and stuff them with cheese and meat (if desired).
4. Top with salsa and sour cream.

Dishes.Name: Huaraches
Recipe: 1. Prepare the masa by forming thick oval-shaped tortillas.
2. Grill the tortillas on a hot comal or griddle until lightly golden.
3. Spread refried beans on top of each tortilla.
4. Grill the pork or other meat of your choice (e.g., grilled steak or chorizo) and place it on top of the huaraches.
5. Add grilled cactus (nopal) slices and top with salsa, queso fresco, chopped onion, and cilantro. Serve warm.

Dishes.Name: Pambazos
Recipe: 1. Cook the chorizo with diced potatoes until crispy.
2. Slice the bread and lightly toast it.
3. Dip the bread in a red sauce (made from guajillo chilies) to coat it.
4. Fill the bread with the chorizo and potato mixture.
5. Top with shredded lettuce, sour cream, queso fresco, and salsa. Serve warm.

Dishes.Name: Esquites
Recipe: 1. Boil or grill the corn kernels until tender.
2. In a separate pan, melt butter and mix it with the corn.
3. Stir in a generous amount of mayonnaise.
4. Squeeze lime juice over the corn and add chili powder to taste.
5. Serve in cups, topped with crumbled queso fresco and more chili powder if desired.

Dishes.Name: Elote
Recipe: 1. Grill the corn on the cob until slightly charred.
2. While the corn is still warm, spread a layer of mayonnaise over it.
3. Sprinkle crumbled cotija cheese over the mayonnaise.
4. Dust with chili powder and squeeze fresh lime juice over the top. Serve immediately.

Dishes.Name: Tortas
Recipe: 1. Grill the meat of your choice (pork, beef, or chicken).
2. Slice the bolillo or telera bread and toast it.
3. Spread refried beans on one side of the bread.
4. Add the grilled meat, avocado slices, lettuce, tomato, and onion.
5. Top with salsa and close the sandwich. Serve immediately.

Dishes.Name: Burritos
Recipe: 1. Cook the rice and beans separately.
2. Grill or cook the meat of your choice (beef, chicken, or pork).
3. Warm the flour tortillas.
4. Layer the rice, beans, meat, cheese, lettuce, and tomato on the tortilla.
5. Add sour cream and salsa, then roll up the tortilla tightly.
6. Serve immediately, optionally with extra salsa.

Dishes.Name: Pasta
Recipe: Mix flour, eggs, and a pinch of salt to make a dough.
Roll it out and cut into desired shapes (spaghetti, fettuccine, etc.).
Boil in salted water until al dente and serve with sauce of choice.

Dishes.Name: Pizza
Recipe: For the dough, mix flour, water, yeast, salt, and some olive oil.
Let the dough rise until it doubles in size.
Roll out the dough, add tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil.
Bake at 220¬∞C for 10-15 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Ravioli
Recipe: For the pasta, mix flour and eggs until smooth dough forms.
Fill with a mixture of ricotta and spinach.
Cook in boiling water and serve with your favorite sauce.

Dishes.Name: Lasagna
Recipe: Saut√© meat with onion and garlic, add tomato sauce.
Layer pasta, meat, and bechamel in a dish, top with cheese.
Bake at 180¬∞C for 30-40 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
Recipe: Cook the pasta.
Saut√© the pancetta until crispy.
Mix eggs with grated cheese and pepper.
Toss the egg mixture with hot pasta and pancetta quickly.

Dishes.Name: Risotto
Recipe: Saut√© onion in butter.
Add rice and wine, and cook on low heat, adding broth gradually.
When rice is creamy, add parmesan cheese.

Dishes.Name: Polenta
Recipe: Boil water with salt.
Add cornmeal slowly, and cook on low heat, stirring.
Add butter and cheese at the end.

Dishes.Name: Ossobuco
Recipe: Brown the meat and set aside.
Saut√© the vegetables, add wine, return meat, and cook on low heat with broth until tender.

Dishes.Name: Arancini
Recipe: Form rice balls with cheese in the center.
Coat with egg and breadcrumbs.
Fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Gnocchi
Recipe: Boil potatoes and mash.
Mix with flour and egg to form a dough.
Cut into small pieces and cook in boiling water until they float.

Dishes.Name: Focaccia
Recipe: Mix Ingredients and let dough rise.
Spread on a baking tray, sprinkle with rosemary.
Bake at 220¬∞C for 20 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Calzone
Recipe: Fill the dough with Ingredients.
Fold and seal edges.
Bake at 200¬∞C until golden.

Dishes.Name: Panzanella
Recipe: Soak the bread in water, squeeze and mix with tomato, cucumber, onion, and basil.
Dress with oil and vinegar.

Dishes.Name: Bruschetta
Recipe: Toast bread.
Rub with garlic and top with diced tomato, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil.

Dishes.Name: Caprese Salad
Recipe: Alternate slices of tomato and mozzarella.
Add basil, and drizzle with oil and salt.

Dishes.Name: Tiramisu
Recipe: Dip ladyfingers in coffee.
Layer with mascarpone, egg, and sugar mixture.
Top with cocoa powder and refrigerate.

Dishes.Name: Panna Cotta
Recipe: Heat cream with sugar and vanilla.
Dissolve gelatin and mix well.
Refrigerate until set.

Dishes.Name: Cannoli
Recipe: Form tubes from dough and fry.
Fill with sweetened ricotta, cinnamon, chocolate chunks, and candied fruit.

Dishes.Name: Gelato
Recipe: Mix milk, cream, and sugar; heat.
Add egg yolk and flavoring.
Freeze while stirring constantly.

Dishes.Name: Asado
Ingredients: Chimichurri (olive oil, wine vinegar, garlic, parsley, oregano, chili flakes, red bell pepper)
Salsa criolla (1 tomato, 1 onion, 1 red bell pepper, 1 green bell pepper, oil, vinegar)
Recipe: 1. Light the fire with charcoal or wood (preferably quebracho or espinillo) and let it create a good bed of coals.
2. While the grill heats up, season the meat with coarse salt on both sides and let it rest for a few minutes.
3. When the coals are ready, place the meat on the grill, bone side down if applicable, and cook over low heat.
4. Add the sweetbreads, chitterlings, and kidneys, turning them for even cooking.
5. Let the meat cook for 1-2 hours, depending on the cut, until juicy and golden.
6. Meanwhile, prepare the chimichurri and salsa criolla by mixing all Ingredients.
7. Serve the asado with the side dishes and enjoy with bread for choripanes.

Dishes.Name: Empanadas
Ingredients: 500 grams of ground beef (preferably shoulder or top round)
1 package of empanada dough for baking (approximately 12 discs)
2 tablespoons of oil (preferably beef fat or neutral oil)
Recipe: 1. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat and add the chopped onions and diced red bell pepper. Saut√© until soft.
2. Add the ground beef and cook until browned and fully cooked.
3. Add the paprika, cumin, chili flakes, salt, and pepper to taste. Mix well and cook for a few minutes to blend flavors.
4. Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
5. Add the chopped hard-boiled eggs and sliced olives to the filling, and mix gently.
6. Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C (392¬∞F).
7. Fill each empanada disc with a spoonful of meat mixture. Moisten the edges with water, fold over, and seal with a fork or by crimping.
8. Place on a baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
9. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Milanesa
Ingredients: 500 gr Flank or rib steak (churrasco in Spain)
1 tsp Ground chili (replace with 2 crushed dried chili peppers)
Recipe: 1. Season beef or chicken cutlets with salt and pepper.
2. Dip each cutlet in beaten egg, then coat in breadcrumbs.
3. Heat oil in a skillet and fry each cutlet until golden and crispy on both sides.
4. Drain on paper towels and serve with lemon wedges.

Dishes.Name: Locro
Recipe: 1. Soak corn and beans overnight.
2. In a large pot, cook diced beef with chorizo until browned.
3. Add corn, beans, and water, then simmer on low heat for several hours until everything is tender.
4. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.

Dishes.Name: Humitas
Recipe: 1. Mix grated corn with chopped onions, cheese, salt, and pepper.
2. Spoon mixture into corn husks and fold them closed.
3. Steam for about 30-40 minutes, until filling is set.

Dishes.Name: Choripan
Recipe: 1. Grill the sausage until fully cooked.
2. Place sausage in crusty bread and add chimichurri sauce on top.
3. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Matambre
Recipe: 1. Cook the flank steak with vegetables and egg.
2. Roll the steak tightly and tie with string.
3. Boil or bake until tender, then cool, slice, and serve cold.

Dishes.Name: Provoleta
Ingredients: 2 thick wheels (about 8-9 ounces each) of provolone cheese with rind
4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil, or as needed
Sea salt or kosher salt, to taste
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Recipe: 1. Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Place the provolone cheese wheels on the grill or skillet.
3. Cook until the cheese melts and becomes lightly golden around the edges.
4. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper to taste.
5. Serve immediately and enjoy.

Dishes.Name: Alfajores
Ingredients: Shredded coconut or melted chocolate (for coating)
Recipe: 1. Spread dulce de leche between two cookies to form a sandwich.
2. Roll the edges of the sandwich in shredded coconut or dip in melted chocolate.
3. Let it chill until the coating sets, then serve.

Dishes.Name: Dulce de Leche
Ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda (optional, for smooth texture)
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, combine the milk and sugar.
2. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
3. Continue cooking for 1.5-2 hours, until the mixture thickens and turns a caramel color.
4. If desired, add baking soda towards the end of cooking to achieve a smoother consistency.
5. Let it cool before using as a filling or topping.

Dishes.Name: Pastelitos
Ingredients: 200 grams of butter or vegetable shortening
Recipe: 1. In a large bowl, mix the flour, butter (or shortening), salt, and lemon juice. Add water gradually and knead until a smooth dough forms.
2. In a separate bowl, combine the cornstarch with a little water to create a paste, then add to the dough mixture.
3. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface and cut into small squares.
4. Place a piece of quince paste in the center of each square.
5. Fold the dough over the paste and seal the edges tightly.
6. Heat the oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C).
7. Fry the pastelitos until golden brown, then drain on paper towels.
8. In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Heat until sugar dissolves and becomes a syrup.
9. Brush the warm pastelitos with the syrup and sprinkle with colored sprinkles.
10. Serve warm and enjoy!

Dishes.Name: Facturas
Ingredients: 10 g dry baker's yeast or 25 g fresh yeast
Recipe: 1. In a bowl, combine the warm milk and yeast. Let it sit for 5 minutes until the yeast is activated.
2. In a separate large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, salt, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the eggs and activated yeast mixture to the dry Ingredients. Mix to form a dough.
4. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Add the butter and continue kneading until fully incorporated.
6. Cover the dough with a cloth and let it rise for about 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
7. Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F).
8. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and divide it into small portions. Shape into your desired forms (like small buns or twists).
9. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
11. Let cool slightly, then serve. Optionally, you can dust with powdered sugar or drizzle with icing.

Dishes.Name: Hamburger
Recipe: 1. Mix ground beef with salt and pepper to taste.
2. Shape the mixture into a burger patty.
3. Cook the burger in a skillet or on a grill over medium-high heat until the desired level of doneness.
4. Serve the burger on a hamburger bun with your favorite toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese, etc.).

Dishes.Name: Fries
Recipe: 1. Peel and cut the potatoes into evenly sized strips.
2. Heat oil in a skillet or deep fryer to 180¬∞C.
3. Fry the potatoes in the hot oil until golden and crispy.
4. Drain the fries on paper towels and season with salt to taste.

Dishes.Name: Pizza
Recipe: 1. Preheat the oven to 220¬∞C.
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured flat surface.
3. Top the dough with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and other toppings like pepperoni, ham, or mushrooms.
4. Place the pizza in the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden.

Dishes.Name: Hot Dog
Recipe: 1. Cook the sausages in hot water or on a grill.
2. Place the cooked sausages inside a hot dog bun.
3. Add mustard, ketchup, onions, or any other sauce or condiment of your choice.

Dishes.Name: Cheeseburger
Recipe: 1. Shape ground beef into a patty and season with salt and pepper.
2. Cook the burger in a skillet or on a grill over medium-high heat.
3. Add a slice of cheddar cheese on top of the meat when it is almost done, allowing it to melt.
4. Serve the burger on a hamburger bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, and your choice of condiments.

Dishes.Name: Mac and Cheese
Recipe: 1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet and add flour to make a roux.
3. Gradually add milk to the skillet, whisking constantly until the sauce thickens.
4. Stir in shredded cheddar cheese and mix until melted.
5. Add the cooked pasta and mix well until it is fully coated with the cheese sauce.

Dishes.Name: Fried Chicken
Recipe: 1. Season chicken pieces with salt, pepper, and other spices to taste.
2. Dredge the chicken in seasoned flour, ensuring it is well-coated.
3. Heat oil in a deep skillet to 180¬∞C.
4. Fry the chicken in the hot oil until golden and crispy on the outside and cooked through on the inside.
5. Drain the chicken on paper towels before serving.

Dishes.Name: Pancakes
Recipe: 1. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, sugar, milk, egg, and melted butter until smooth.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and grease it with a little butter or oil.
3. Pour small amounts of batter onto the hot skillet.
4. Cook each pancake until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden.
5. Serve with maple syrup, fruit, or whipped cream.

Dishes.Name: Waffles
Recipe: 1. Mix flour, baking powder, sugar, egg, milk, and melted butter in a bowl until smooth.
2. Preheat a waffle iron and grease it with a little oil or butter.
3. Pour the batter into the waffle iron and cook according to the device's instructions, until the waffles are golden and crispy.
4. Serve with fruit, maple syrup, or whipped cream.

Dishes.Name: Donuts
Recipe: 1. Mix flour, sugar, yeast, warm milk, egg, and melted butter in a bowl.
2. Knead until smooth and let the dough rise for 1 hour.
3. Roll out the dough and cut it with a donut cutter.
4. Fry the donuts in hot oil until golden on the outside.

Dishes.Name: Apple Pie
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
2. Peel and slice apples, then mix with sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice.
3. Roll out pie dough and place in pie dish.
4. Add apple mixture into crust, dot with butter.
5. Cover with top crust, seal edges, and make slits.
6. Bake for 50-60 minutes until golden.

Dishes.Name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C).
2. Cream together butter, brown sugar, and sugar.
3. Add vanilla extract and egg; mix well.
4. Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Fold in chocolate chips.
6. Drop by spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Brownies
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) and grease a baking pan.
2. Melt butter and mix with sugar.
3. Add eggs and vanilla extract.
4. Stir in cocoa powder, flour, salt, and baking powder.
5. Pour into the pan and bake for 20-25 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Ice Cream
Recipe: 1. Mix heavy cream, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt in a bowl.
2. Pour mixture into an ice cream maker.
3. Churn according to the manufacturer's instructions until thickened.
4. Freeze for a few hours before serving.

Dishes.Name: Clam Chowder
Recipe: 1. Cook bacon in a pot until crispy; remove and set aside.
2. Saut√© onion and celery in the bacon fat.
3. Add butter and flour to make a roux.
4. Pour in milk and cream, stirring to thicken.
5. Add diced potatoes and simmer until tender.
6. Add clams, salt, and pepper, and cook until clams are done.

Dishes.Name: Lobster Roll
Recipe: 1. Mix lobster meat with mayonnaise, celery, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
2. Toast hot dog buns with butter.
3. Fill buns with lobster mixture and serve.

Dishes.Name: BBQ Ribs
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 300¬∞F (150¬∞C).
2. Rub ribs with salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
3. Wrap ribs in foil and bake for 2.5-3 hours.
4. Unwrap ribs, brush with BBQ sauce, and broil for 5-10 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Steak
Recipe: 1. Season steak with salt and pepper.
2. Heat a skillet with butter, garlic, and rosemary.
3. Sear steak on both sides until desired doneness.
4. Let rest for a few minutes before serving.

Dishes.Name: Sushi
Dishes.Ingredients: Sushi rice (approximately 150-200 grs. per diner), Rice vinegar, Nori seaweed sheets, Soy sauce, Wasabi, Fish filling: salmon/tuna/surimi sticks/cooked shrimp/mackerel‚Ä¶ (approximately 100-150 gr. per diner), Vegetable-fruit filling: cucumber/carrot/avocado/mango‚Ä¶, It is not an ingredient in itself, but we need a bamboo mat as material to roll the sushi rolls
Dishes.Recipe: The first thing we will do is put the rice in a strainer and rinse it several times with very cold water, until it comes out clear, to remove all the starch. When it is ready, we boil it using the same amount of water as rice. First, we put the rice on medium heat for a couple of minutes and then we lower the heat to minimum and let it boil for 10 minutes. It is important that the pot is covered throughout the cooking process. After this time, we remove the pot from the heat and let the rice rest, uncovered, for another 15 minutes. While the rice rests, we prepare the sushi-zu, which is the vinegar dressing that we will add later. The mixture is made up of rice vinegar, sugar and salt, in a proportion of 5:2:1, that is, for every five parts of vinegar, we put two of sugar and one of salt. We need sushi-zu in a ratio of 1:5, that is, one part of seasoning for every five parts of dry rice that we have boiled. To prepare it, we heat the vinegar slightly in a saucepan, dissolve the sugar and salt in it and let it cool.Once the rice and the mixture are ready, we spread the boiled rice on a tray or container, preferably made of wood, and mix it with the seasoning that we have made using a wooden paddle. While we mix it, we fan the rice so that it is at room temperature. To prepare the filling, we cut the Ingredients that we have chosen into thin longitudinal strips that are as similar as possible. The fish can be raw (preferably previously frozen for safety), marinated, or semi-cooked, to taste, and the vegetables are usually added raw. Once we have the rice seasoned on one side, and the filling on the other, it is time to assemble the rolls. To make the rolls, spread the bamboo mat on a flat surface and cover it with plastic wrap. Place a sheet of nori on top with the shiniest side facing down and the stripes perpendicular to you. With your hands moistened with water, take rice and spread it evenly, creating a layer of rice about a centimetre thick and leaving a centimetre gap at the top edge of the nori (the area furthest from you). Once the base is prepared, place the filling in the centre of the bottom of the nori. As a variation, if you want to make a sushi roll with rice on the outside (uramaki) and coated with sesame seeds, make the filling in another way: with the rice placed on the nori, turn it over and put the filling directly on the seaweed. homemade-sushi-mat To form the roll, with a quick movement, take the bottom part of the mat and wrap the Ingredients and rice in it, making a roll, while pressing lightly. The roll will reach the space of seaweed that we have left without rice, and it is there where we seal it to the roll by moistening it a little. Once this is done, we cut the roll in one firm stroke into 6-8 portions with a very sharp and slightly wet knife, so as not to break it. We prepare the soy sauce and wasabi to season and moisten the pieces, and the ginger if we want to change from one flavor to another

Dishes.Name: Ramen
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 Leek (green part only), 1 Small Onion (or 1/2 large), 4 Slices of fresh ginger, 1/2 Carrot, 4 Cloves of garlic, 2 Eggs, 1 Pork rib (can be another part), Rice noodles (can be others), 1 Glass of Soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. of sake (I: vodka), 3 Tbsp. of mirin (I: sweet white wine), 2 Tsp. of sugar, 1 Green onion, Salt
Dishes.Recipe: Separate the pork rib from the bone. Put the bone in a pot with boiling water. When it changes color, remove it and wash it with cold water. Place the pork rib bone, the leek (reserve 1 of the leaves), 3 crushed garlic cloves, 3 slices of ginger, the onion and the carrot in a pot with water. Add salt. Boil for 1 hour on low heat. Brown the pork rib (the boneless part) in a pan, on both sides. Once browned, add it to the pot and leave it for 10 minutes.Boil the 2 eggs in water with a splash of vinegar. Leave for 6 minutes in total‚Ä¶ no more than that! Cool and peel. Put the soy sauce, mirin, sugar and sake in a separate pot. Add the crushed garlic clove, the slice of ginger and the leek leaf that we had reserved. Cook over low heat and turn off when it starts to boil. Marinate the pork and the whole, peeled eggs in this sauce for at least 1/2 hour. Cook the pasta as indicated on the package. Serve: place 3-4 tablespoons of the soy sauce from the marinade on the plate. Add the portion of noodles in the center and the soup broth until half the plate is filled. Place the pork, cut into thin strips, on one side. On the other, place an egg cut in half (the yolk should be almost liquid). Sprinkle with the green onion, cut very finely and in chamfers.

Dishes.Name: Tempura
Dishes.Ingredients: 500 gr of medium or large shrimp, peeled and cleaned. 1 cup of wheat flour. 1 cup of cold water. 1 egg. 1 teaspoon of baking powder. 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Vegetable oil for frying.
Dishes.Recipe: To start, mix the flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl and set aside. Meanwhile, in another bowl, beat the egg and add the cold water, then add the flour mixture. Let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes. Separately, heat the oil in a frying pan. Once it is very hot, dip the shrimp in the tempura mixture and cook them in the pan for 2 to 3 minutes or until they are golden and crispy. Finally, drain the shrimp on absorbent paper to remove excess oil and serve. You can accompany them with rice and a mayonnaise and chipotle dressing.

Dishes.Name: Udon
Dishes.Ingredients: 4 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons mirin wine, 2 tablespoons sake, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 400g pre-cooked Udon noodles, 1 liter chicken broth. You can make it with chicken broth powder
Dishes.Recipe: In a saucepan, mix the soy sauce, mirin, sake and sugar. Add the Ingredients corresponding to the option you have chosen. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat and boil for 20 minutes (2 minutes if you have chosen option 1). Remove the shiitake mushrooms or kombu seaweed with a slotted spoon. Taste the broth and adjust the seasoning. Add the pre-cooked udon noodles and boil according to the manufacturer's instructions, usually about 3 minutes. Serve in individual bowls and garnish with a sprinkle of finely chopped spring onion.

Dishes.Name: Soba
Dishes.Ingredients: 1.5 liters of water, 1 large piece of kombu about 15 ‚Äì 18 grams, 2 dried shiitake mushrooms, 300 grams of soba noodles, 175 ml of soy sauce, 120 ml of mirin, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 1 tablespoon of sesame seeds optional, 2 chopped scallions (optional)
Dishes.Recipe: The night before, put the water, kombu, and mushrooms in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate until you are ready to make the soup. Bring a pot of water to a boil and add the noodles. Boil according to product directions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water, gently scrubbing to remove starch. Drain again and set aside. Remove the kombu and mushrooms from the water and bring the broth to a boil. Add the soy sauce, mirin, and sugar and mix well to dissolve the sugar. Divide the soba into four bowls and ladle the broth over the top. Garnish with sesame seeds and scallions, if desired.

Dishes.Name: Miso Soup
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 l water or dashi broth, 15 g dried wakame seaweed, 3 tablespoons miso, 200 g tofu, 50 g leek, 50 g spring onion, soba noodles (optional)
Dishes.Recipe: We put the water in a pot and bring it to the boil. Once it starts to boil, we take a little water into a glass to dissolve the miso later. We put the wakame seaweed in the pot and let it cook for 5 minutes. Then we add the tofu cut into small cubes of approximately 1 cm and the vegetables in small pieces. We cook the soup for another 5 minutes We dissolve the miso in water and, when the soup is ready, we remove it from the heat and add the water with dissolved miso. Ready to serve. If you like it with soba noodles and optionally, you just have to follow the manufacturer's instructions to cook them. Once you have them, put a small amount in each bowl pouring the miso soup on top, in a similar way to when we make ramen soup at home.

Dishes.Name: Onigiri
Dishes.Ingredients: 2 cups round grain rice (paella type), 2 and 1/2 cups water, 2 sheets of Nori seaweed, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup water, optional: toasted sesame seeds, Fillings: Steamed or grilled salmon, chopped. Tuna with a little mayonnaise. Crab sticks. You can add these fillings: scallions or pickled ginger, chopped very finely.
Dishes.Recipe: Wash the rice with water in a strainer until the water runs clear. Put the water and rice in a saucepan. Then, bring to the boil at maximum heat until the boiling water is about to come out. Once you have reached this point, turn off the heat. If there is still water left, turn it to minimum heat for a little longer. Once the heat is off, let it rest for about 10 minutes. During the entire cooking and resting process of the rice, preferably the lid should not be removed. After 10 minutes have passed, remove the lid and let it rest for another 5 to 10 minutes. Once the rice has finished cooking, leave it in a bowl covered with a damp cloth so that it does not dry out until it cools. Meanwhile, heat the water and salt in a saucepan until it dissolves. When the salt water cools, wet your hands in it so that the rice does not stick to it when you work with it. Prepare the different types of fillings that you want to taste. To add the filling, put a good spoonful of rice on one hand. Put the filling in the center of it. Next, you will have to finish forming the ball, completely covering the filling. Finally, give it a triangular shape (with rounded corners). You must press the ball thoroughly so that it remains compact. Once this is done, place a small sheet of nori underneath, which will make it easier to handle.

Dishes.Name: Yakitori
Dishes.Ingredients: Boneless, skinless chicken thighs 5, Spring onion 3, Leek (for the sauce) 1, Soy sauce (for the sauce) 200 ml, Mirin or rice wine (for the sauce) 125 ml, Cooking sake (for the sauce) 125 ml, Brown sugar (for the sauce) 20 g, Sunflower oil for greasing the griddle, Skewers 8
Dishes.Recipe: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Cut the spring onions, first lengthwise down the centre and then into pieces of about two or three centimetres. Thread onto skewers, alternating pieces of chicken and spring onion. Set aside. Prepare the teriyaki sauce. Cut the leek into large pieces and put them in a pot together with the sake, mirin, soy sauce and brown sugar. Cook over a low heat until the sauce thickens and reduces by half. Cooking on a griddle or grill: Heat a non-stick griddle or grill and brush with a little sunflower oil. Mark the skewers on all sides while brushing with the sauce. Turn them over so they cook on all sides. Serve hot, brushing each skewer with sauce just before serving.

Dishes.Name: Gyoza
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 pack of Gyoza noodles (approx. 50 pieces), 400 g minced pork, 150 g Chinese cabbage, 50 g spring onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tablespoon grated ginger, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1/2 tablespoon cornstarch, a little sesame oil, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1.5 tablespoons rice vinegar, a little sesame oil
Dishes.Recipe: Chop the spring onion and the Chinese cabbage. Set them aside for later. Put the minced pork, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, salt, sugar, cornstarch, and sesame oil in a bowl and mix everything well until it becomes sticky. Add the spring onion and the Chinese cabbage and mix again. Cover with cling film and leave in the fridge for about 20 minutes. Filling the Gyozas: Take a piece of Gyoza dough and put a teaspoon of the filling in the centre. Wet the outside of the dough with your fingers, fold it in half and close it with your fingers. I make 3 folds on each side from the middle, although you can also start folding on one side and finish on the other. To finish, press the folds a little so they don't open. While we are doing the rest, we put them on a plate and cover them with a damp cloth so that they do not dry out. Grilling the Gyozas: In a frying pan, spread a splash of vegetable oil and place our gyozas. When they are toasted on the base, add a splash of sesame oil and add water to cover the entire bottom well. I also add a teaspoon of cornstarch to this water so that a crispy crust forms on the base. Cover the pan and let it cook until the water evaporates, it will take between 8 and 10 minutes. Once the water has evaporated from the pan, the gyozas will be toasted and crispy on the base and well cooked but softer on top, put them on a plate and they are ready to eat, accompany them with our sauce. Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, rice vinegar and a little sesame oil, stir well and it is ready.

Dishes.Name: Tonkatsu
Dishes.Ingredients: 2 pork chops, 1 egg, 50 g. Panko, 2 tablespoons of wheat flour, Vegetable oil, A little salt and black pepper, 2.5 tablespoons of Worcestershire sauce (Perrins sauce), 2 tablespoons of ketchup, 2 tablespoons of oyster sauce, 1 teaspoon of white sugar, 100 g. of cabbage, Japanese rice ¬´Gohan¬ª
Dishes.Recipe: We make some small cuts between the fatty part and the meat of the pork chop. (The meat and the fat have different elasticity, with the cuts we will avoid it deforming when frying). With the help of a hammer to tenderize meat or with the back of the knife we ‚Äã‚Äãgive it a few blows so that it is more tender. We salt and pepper both sides and it is ready to bread. Coat the chop We flour the chop on both sides. We remove the excess flour and bathe it with the egg. We coat it well with Panko. When it is well breaded, we remove the excess Panko and it is ready to fry. Fry: In a saucepan with plenty of vegetable oil over medium heat we fry it for 2 to 2 and a half minutes on each side. When it is golden brown we remove it to absorbent paper. Prepare the Tonkatsu sauce:In a bowl we add the Worcestershire sauce (Perrins sauce), the oyster sauce, the ketchup and the white sugar. Mix well and it is ready to use. Serve: Cut the chop into pieces, place it on a plate accompanied by the cabbage that we have cut and serve with the Tonkatsu sauce.

Dishes.Name: Teriyaki
Dishes.Ingredients: The cut of chicken you prefer: we recommend boneless, skinless thighs, but it must be free-range, quality-fed chicken. Allow two pieces per person Onion or spring onion Sunflower oil. If you use olive oil, choose a mild one Toasted sesame seeds Soy sauce Mirin Sake Sugar Long-grain rice
Dishes.Recipe: We'll start by preparing the teriyaki sauce. In a saucepan, put 100 ml of soy sauce, 45 ml of sake, 40 ml of mirin and two tablespoons of sugar. Reduce the sauce over low heat until it has a consistency similar to that of liquid caramel. If it doesn't stay thick, you can add corn starch to help. If you like it sweeter you can always add more sugar or mirin. With this you would have the basic sauce, but you can customize it by adding ground ginger, lemon or orange zest or finely chopped garlic. And what happens if I can't find mirin or sake? You can substitute them with local Ingredients, but the result will not be exactly the same. You can replace the sake with semi-dry white wine and the mirin with a sweet sherry. If you only have sake, add a little more sugar and that's it. Once the sauce is prepared, set aside. In a saucepan with water and salt, boil the rice for the garnish. Use basmati rice or steamed rice to make it looser. Cover the bottom of a frying pan with sunflower oil and heat over high heat. Cut the onion or spring onion into julienne strips and add to the pan when the oil is very hot. Cut the thighs into medium pieces and add them to the onion so they brown on the outside. When the chicken has that golden colour that we all like, add the teriyaki sauce to the pan and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. You will see how the sauce sticks to the meat, giving it an irresistible shine. Serve the chicken with its rice garnish and, if you want, decorate with some toasted sesame seeds.

Dishes.Name: Sashimi
Dishes.Ingredients: 300 g fresh salmon fillet, defrosted 20 ml soy sauce or ponzu sauce 5 g pickled ginger  1 teaspoon wasabi paste
Dishes.Recipe: For this type of preparation based on raw fish, the fish must have been previously frozen as indicated in the introduction and defrosted in the refrigerator. In this case, 300 g of salmon. Once defrosted, the skin is removed from the fish and the edges are trimmed so that the fillet is as rectangular as possible. The next step is to cut the salmon into slices about 3 mm thick. To do this, sharpen a knife very well and cut each slice of salmon in a single movement, sliding the knife gently forward. Proceed in the same way with each slice until you have finished cutting the entire salmon fillet. To serve the salmon, present it on a platter or plate, accompanied by 20 ml of soy sauce or ponzu sauce, 5 g of pickled ginger and 1 teaspoon of wasabi paste.

Dishes.Name: Mochi
Dishes.Ingredients: filling:80-100mL of whipping cream, 1cs of sugar (15g), 4-5 strawberries dough: 5cs of glutinous rice flour (75g)2cs of sugar (30g) 90-100mL of water approx.Colorant (optional)Fine corn flour (to flour the dough)
Dishes.Recipe: First, cut about 4-5 strawberries into small cubes. Next, put about 80-100mL of cold whipping cream in a bowl and add 1 tbsp of sugar. Beat well until you see that the cream is whipped and no longer has a liquid consistency (if you do it with a whisk mixer it will be much faster and easier). Add the strawberries you just cut to the bowl of cream and mix gently. Be careful not to mix too much so that the cream does not lose its creaminess. Take the filling and try to make 6-8 small balls with the help of a couple of spoons. Put these strawberry and cream balls in the freezer for 1 hour so that they are well frozen.When the filling has been in the freezer for almost 1 hour, you can start making the mochi dough. Although it may seem difficult at first glance, making the mochi dough is not complicated at all. Add 5 tbsp of glutinous rice flour and 2 tbsp of sugar to a bowl. Add water little by little (about 90-100mL in total) while stirring with a spoon until you get a consistency similar to that of liquid yogurt. Next, to get the typical consistency of this Japanese sweet, you will have to heat the dough in the microwave in intervals (put the bowl in the microwave with a plate on top to cover it) and mix it between intervals, like this: Heat the dough for 1 minute and stir well for 1 minute.Heat the dough for 1 more minute and mix it again for another minute. Heat the dough for 30 seconds and stir well again. Heat the dough for another 30 seconds, mix again and it should be ready.To make these strawberry mochis, wait for the dough to cool a little, flour it (with cornstarch or fine corn flour) and cut it into 6-8 pieces (depending on the size you want them to be). Flatten each piece of dough and try to make them into a circle.  Take the strawberry and cream balls out of the freezer, flour the dough with cornstarch and fill each piece of dough with one of these balls.Join all the parts of the mochi dough in the center until it is well closed.  Do this with all the pieces of dough and all the balls until you have created all the Japanese mochis. Leave them at room temperature so that the mochi filling defrosts and becomes creamy.

Dishes.Name: Dorayaki
Dishes.Ingredients: Eggs  2 Sugar 50g Honey 15ml Pastry flour 85g Salt a pinch  chemical yeast 2ml Water  40ml  Extra virgin olive oil Anko or chocolate cream to fill
Dishes.Recipe: Arrange the eggs in a bowl with the sugar and honey. Beat with a whisk until it doubles or almost triples in volume, and has a pale color and thick texture. Sift the flour with the yeast and a light pinch of salt on top. Mix with gentle, enveloping movements. Add the water and cover Let it rest for at least 15 minutes at room temperature. Prepare a griddle or good non-stick frying pan by lightly greasing it with sunflower oil or melted butter. Heat over medium heat and add ladles of dough, shaping it into a circular shape with the back of a spoon. Cook until bubbles appear, slide a spatula underneath and turn over. Cook until golden brown and remove. Continue until the dough is finished. Spread half of the pancakes with anko, chocolate or cream and form the dorayakis by joining with the rest.

Dishes.Name: Taiyaki
Dishes.Ingredients: 2 cups of wheat, flour 1 teaspoon baking soda or baking soda,1/2 teaspoon salt  2 tablespoons of sugar 1 egg 1 or 1+1/2 cup of water (depending on the flour)    180g azuki paste, anko   Vegetable oil Fish Shape Taiyaki Mold
Dishes.Recipe: Mix the flour, salt, sugar and baking soda by sifting them into a bowl. Make a hole in the middle and add the previously beaten egg along with the water, mixing it little by little, it should have a creamy texture, neither too liquid nor too pasty. Heat the taiyaki mold griddle a little. With a brush spread a little oil on the mold. Pour the mixed Ingredients into the Taiyaki mold, filling it approximately halfway. Put a good spoonful of anko paste or the filling you prefer, on the mixture poured into the mold. Finish by covering with a little more of the previous mixture.  Close the mold and heat it on both sides continuously at intervals until it is cooked for a few minutes, it should be golden brown. let it cool

Dishes.Name: Oden
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 large piece of dried kombu seaweed 1 medium daikon radish, peeled and cut into 1-inch slices 3 large carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch slices 3 large potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch slices 12 cups water or broth, as needed  1 hard boiled egg per person 1 block firm tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes ¬æ cup mirin ¬æ cup soy sauce, low sodium  ¬º cup sugar Dry mustard powder, such as Colman's, or the Asian market equivalent (optional)
Dishes.Recipe: Place the kombu in a large pot. Add enough water to cover it completely. Let soak for at least 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, heat the pot over high heat until almost boiling. Lower the heat to medium-low heat and cook.Add the daikon and carrots to the pot, adding more water to cover. Let the stew cook until the vegetables are soft, about 1 hour. By then the kombu will be very soft. Add a little water to the mustard powder to create a paste. Set aside. Add the potatoes and cook for 20 minutes. Add the hard-boiled eggs, tofu, mirin, soy sauce, and sugar. Cook for 20 minutes. Cut the kombu, you should be able to do this inside the pot with a spatula. Add more soy sauce or sugar to taste, if needed. Serve the stew with a teaspoon of mustard (it's spicy) to mix with the broth if desired. Eat with hot rice, or sake.

Dishes.Name: Shabu-shabu
Dishes.Ingredients: 250 g beef fillets 120 g shiitake mushrooms 120 g enoki mushrooms 16 leaves of bok choy 2 leeks 120g tofu 90 g dried konbu seaweed 500 ml of water Dry ramen or udon type noodles (optional) 500 g of rice
Dishes.Recipe: First we prepare the broth. To do this, we put the water in a saucepan with the konbu seaweed over medium heat for 10 minutes. When it starts to boil, remove the seaweed from the water and let it cook for a couple more minutes. After this time, we strain the water to eliminate any remains of algae. Meanwhile, we cook the rice in another pot to have it ready. We prepare the Ingredients by washing the mushrooms and vegetables well to remove any remaining dirt, and then cutting them into strips of the same size. We cut the tofu into small cubes and the Chinese cabbage into strips. We bring a stove to the center of the table and heat the konbu seaweed broth until it comes to a boil. Each diner is served a bowl with cooked rice and another with ponzu sauce. The diners cook the Ingredients they want in the broth and, once they are ready, they dip them in ponzu sauce. Ready to taste.

Dishes.Name: Sukiyaki
Dishes.Ingredients: 200 grams of beef cut very thin (for example for carpaccio) 1 package of yaki-dofu tofu Shiitake mushrooms enoki mushrooms Spring onion or green onion Leeks Shirataki noodles 1 package fresh udon noodles 1/3 cup soy sauce 3 tablespoons sake  4 tablespoons of sugar  3/4 cup dashi broth  2 bowls of Japanese white rice boiled and ready to serve 2 eggs
Dishes.Recipe: Cut the leeks and chives lengthwise Cut the yaki-dofu into squares. Separate the meat slices so you can easily manipulate them with chopsticks. Next, mix the soy sauce, sake, sugar and dashi broth in the pot. You can make more broth if you wish, if you see that the quantity has decreased a lot and you still have food left.  On the table, place the dish with all the Ingredients and the stove with the broth heating up. Beat one raw egg per person and serve in a bowl. In another bowl, serve boiled rice to accompany. Once the broth boils, lower the heat and add some vegetable Ingredients (but not the meat). Let them cook over medium heat and when you think they are ready, take them out with chopsticks and dip them in beaten egg before tasting.  The meat cooks in just a few seconds, so you shouldn't leave it in the broth for too long. If you do, it will be hard and won't be as tasty. When you take it out, also dip it in the egg before eating.  The sukiyaki is enjoyed calmly at the table itself, accompanied by a bowl of white rice. The idea is to take Ingredients from the pot as you want to eat. And add more Ingredients when the pot starts to get empty.

Dishes.Name: Coq au Vin
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 whole chicken (cut into pieces), 2 cups red wine, 1 onion (chopped), 2 carrots (sliced), 3 garlic cloves (minced), 1 bouquet garni, 100g bacon lardons, 200g mushrooms, 1 tbsp flour, 1 tbsp butter, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Brown the chicken pieces in a pan. Remove and saut√© bacon lardons, onion, carrots, and garlic. Add wine, bouquet garni, and chicken back into the pan. Simmer for 1.5 hours. In a separate pan, saut√© mushrooms in butter and add to the dish near the end.

Dishes.Name: Ratatouille
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 eggplant, 2 zucchini, 1 bell pepper, 1 onion, 4 tomatoes, 2 garlic cloves, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp thyme, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Slice all vegetables and saut√© onion and garlic in olive oil. Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper, and cook until soft. Add tomatoes and thyme, and simmer for 30 minutes until vegetables are tender.

Dishes.Name: Boeuf Bourguignon
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 kg beef chuck (cut into cubes), 2 cups red wine, 1 onion, 2 carrots, 3 garlic cloves, 200g bacon, 200g mushrooms, 1 bouquet garni, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Brown beef in a pan and set aside. Cook bacon and vegetables in the same pan, then add wine, bouquet garni, and beef. Simmer for 2-3 hours until the meat is tender. Add mushrooms and cook for an additional 10 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Quiche Lorraine
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 pie crust, 200g bacon, 1 onion, 4 eggs, 1 cup cream, 1 cup grated Gruy√®re cheese, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Cook the bacon and onion until crispy. Whisk eggs, cream, and seasonings. Add the bacon mixture and cheese to the pie crust, pour over the egg mixture, and bake at 180¬∞C for 30-35 minutes until set.

Dishes.Name: Cr√™pes
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 cup flour, 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, 1 tbsp butter, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Dishes.Recipe: Mix all Ingredients into a smooth batter. Heat a pan and pour in a small amount of batter, swirling it to cover the base. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side. Serve with lemon, sugar, or your choice of fillings.

Dishes.Name: Escargots de Bourgogne
Dishes.Ingredients: 12 snails, 100g butter, 3 garlic cloves, 2 tbsp parsley, 1 tbsp shallots, 1 tbsp white wine, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Mix butter with garlic, parsley, shallots, wine, salt, and pepper. Stuff snails with the garlic butter mixture and place in snail shells. Bake at 180¬∞C for 10-12 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Soupe √† l'oignon
Dishes.Ingredients: 4 onions, 2 tbsp butter, 4 cups beef broth, 1 cup white wine, 1 baguette, 1 cup Gruy√®re cheese, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Caramelize onions in butter. Add wine and broth, and simmer for 30 minutes. Toast baguette slices and top with grated cheese. Ladle soup into bowls, place bread on top, and broil until cheese melts.

Dishes.Name: Tarte Tatin
Dishes.Ingredients: 6 apples, 100g butter, 150g sugar, 1 sheet puff pastry, 1 tbsp lemon juice.
Dishes.Recipe: Caramelize sugar and butter in a pan, then add apples and cook until tender. Top with puff pastry, bake at 200¬∞C for 20-25 minutes, and flip the tart onto a plate.

Dishes.Name: Madeleines
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup butter, 2 eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp baking powder, zest of 1 lemon.
Dishes.Recipe: Mix Ingredients to form a batter. Spoon batter into madeleine molds and bake at 180¬∞C for 10-12 minutes until golden.

Dishes.Name: Moules Marini√®res
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 kg mussels, 2 tbsp butter, 1 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1 cup white wine, 2 tbsp parsley, salt, pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Saut√© onion and garlic in butter, add mussels and wine. Cover and cook until mussels open. Sprinkle with parsley and season with salt and pepper.

Dishes.Name: Paella
Ingredients: 1 pound of chicken, cut into pieces
Recipe: 1. In a large paella pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the chicken and rabbit pieces and brown on all sides.
3. Add the green beans and cook for a few minutes until tender.
4. Stir in the grated tomato and paprika, and cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Add the rice and saffron, ensuring the rice is evenly coated with the oil and seasonings.
6. Pour in the chicken broth and spread the rice evenly in the pan. Do not stir after this point.
7. Cook on medium heat for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
8. Let the paella rest for 5 minutes, then garnish with lemon wedges before serving.

Dishes.Name: Tortilla Espa√±ola
Ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
Recipe: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced potatoes and onions, and cook until the potatoes are tender but not browned, about 15 minutes.
3. Drain the potatoes and onions, reserving the oil.
4. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt.
5. Add the potato and onion mixture to the eggs and mix gently.
6. Heat a few tablespoons of the reserved oil in the pan and pour in the egg mixture.
7. Cook on low heat for about 5-7 minutes or until the bottom is golden and set.
8. Flip the tortilla onto a plate and slide it back into the pan to cook the other side for an additional 3-4 minutes.
9. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Dishes.Name: Gazpacho
Ingredients: 1 slice of stale bread, soaked in water (optional)
Recipe: 1. In a blender, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, garlic, and soaked bread if using.
2. Blend until smooth and gradually add olive oil and vinegar.
3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Add cold water to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Chill in the refrigerator for at least an hour before serving.
6. Serve cold with a drizzle of olive oil and optional garnish of chopped vegetables or croutons.

Dishes.Name: Jam√≥n Ib√©rico
Recipe: 1. Ensure the Jam√≥n Ib√©rico is at room temperature before serving to enhance its flavor.
2. Slice the jam√≥n thinly using a sharp knife, cutting at an angle for the best texture.
3. Serve the slices on a wooden board or plate.
4. Accompany with breadsticks or slices of crusty bread, if desired.

Dishes.Name: Chorizo
Ingredients: 1 pound of chorizo sausage (Spanish or Mexican, depending on your preference)
1/2 teaspoon of smoked paprika (optional for extra flavor)
Recipe: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. If using, add the minced garlic and saut√© for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
2. Slice the chorizo sausages into 1/4-inch thick rounds. If you prefer, you can remove the casing and crumble the sausage instead.

3. Add the chorizo slices to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chorizo is browned and crispy around the edges. If you like, sprinkle in smoked paprika for an added depth of flavor during the cooking process.
4. Once cooked, remove the chorizo from the pan and place on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.

5. Serve the chorizo warm as a tapa, part of a larger Spanish or Mexican meal, or on top of a salad. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedges on the side for an added zesty kick.

Dishes.Name: Churros
Recipe: 1. In a saucepan, combine the water, butter, sugar, and salt, and bring to a boil.
2. Remove from heat and add the flour all at once, stirring until a dough forms.
3. Transfer the dough to a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
4. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat.
5. Pipe the dough into the hot oil in 4-inch strips and fry until golden brown.
6. Remove and drain on paper towels.
7. Toss the churros in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon before serving.

Dishes.Name: Cocido Madrile√±o
Ingredients: 1 cup of dried chickpeas, soaked overnight
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, add the soaked chickpeas, pork, beef, and chicken, and cover with water.
2. Bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that rises.
3. Lower the heat and simmer for 1 hour.
4. Add the chorizo, morcilla, carrots, potatoes, and cabbage.
5. Cook for another hour or until everything is tender.
6. Serve the broth as a first course, followed by the meats and vegetables on a separate platter.

Dishes.Name: Fabada Asturiana
Ingredients: 1 cup of fabada beans, soaked overnight
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, place the soaked beans, chorizo, morcilla, and pancetta.
2. Cover with water and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer.
3. Add the paprika and saffron, and cook for 2-3 hours or until the beans are tender.
4. Adjust seasoning with salt and serve hot with bread.

Dishes.Name: Pulpo a la Gallega
Recipe: 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and add the octopus.
2. Cook for about 40-50 minutes or until tender.
3. In a separate pot, boil the potato slices until tender and arrange them on a serving dish.
4. Slice the cooked octopus and place on top of the potatoes.
5. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with paprika, and season with salt before serving.

Dishes.Name: Gambas al Ajillo
Ingredients: 1/2 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
Recipe: 1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the garlic and chili pepper and cook until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and fully cooked.
4. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately with crusty bread.

Dishes.Name: Chicken Tikka Masala
Dishes.Ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, garlic, ginger, turmeric, garam masala, chili powder, tomatoes, cream.
Dishes.Recipe: Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices. Grill until cooked. Simmer in tomato cream sauce and serve.

Dishes.Name: Naan Bread
Dishes.Ingredients: Flour, yeast, warm water, sugar, salt, ghee.
Dishes.Recipe: Mix yeast with sugar and warm water. Combine with flour and salt, knead, and let rise. Roll into circles and cook in a hot pan with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Samosas
Dishes.Ingredients: Potatoes, peas, cumin, garam masala, chili, coriander, flour, salt, oil.
Dishes.Recipe: Cook spiced potatoes and peas. Wrap in dough made from flour, salt, and water. Fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Biryani
Dishes.Ingredients: Rice, chicken or lamb, yogurt, onions, garlic, saffron, spices, nuts.
Dishes.Recipe: Layer marinated meat with saffron rice, spices, and nuts. Cook under low heat until done.

Dishes.Name: Butter Chicken
Dishes.Ingredients: Chicken, butter, cream, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, garam masala, chili powder, cumin.
Dishes.Recipe: Cook chicken with spices, garlic, and ginger. Add tomatoes and cream, simmer until thick.

Dishes.Name: Tandoori Chicken
Dishes.Ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, cumin, paprika, garam masala.
Dishes.Recipe: Marinate chicken in spiced yogurt mix. Grill until charred.

Dishes.Name: Palak Paneer
Dishes.Ingredients: Spinach, paneer (cottage cheese), cream, tomatoes, garlic, garam masala.
Dishes.Recipe: Cook spinach with tomatoes, spices, and garlic. Add paneer and cream, heat through.

Dishes.Name: Dal Makhani
Dishes.Ingredients: Black lentils, kidney beans, cream, butter, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, spices.
Dishes.Recipe: Simmer lentils and beans with spices and tomatoes. Finish with cream and butter.

Dishes.Name: Chana Masala
Dishes.Ingredients: Chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, chilies, cumin, coriander.
Dishes.Recipe: Cook chickpeas with onions, tomatoes, spices, and herbs until flavorful.

Dishes.Name: Vada Pav
Dishes.Ingredients: Potato patty, bread bun, garlic, green chilies, mustard seeds, turmeric, gram flour.
Dishes.Recipe: Make spiced potato patties, coat in gram flour batter and fry. Serve in a bun with chutney.

Dishes.Name: Peking Duck
Dishes.Ingredients: Duck, Hoisin sauce, Scallions, Cucumbers, Chinese pancakes
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Marinate the duck with spices and hoisin sauce. 2. Roast the duck in the oven until the skin is crispy. 3. Slice the duck and serve with pancakes, hoisin sauce, scallions, and cucumber slices. 4. Wrap each slice of duck with sauce and vegetables in a pancake.

Dishes.Name: Dim Sum
Dishes.Ingredients: Wonton wrappers, Shrimp, Pork, Ginger, Soy sauce, Green onions
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Mix ground pork, shrimp, ginger, soy sauce, and green onions. 2. Place a small amount of filling in each wonton wrapper and seal. 3. Steam the dim sum for about 10 minutes. 4. Serve with soy sauce or chili oil on the side.

Dishes.Name: Noodles
Dishes.Ingredients: Egg noodles, Soy sauce, Ginger, Garlic, Green onions, Sesame oil, Vegetables (optional)
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Boil the noodles until tender and drain. 2. In a pan, saut√© ginger, garlic, and green onions in sesame oil. 3. Add the noodles and soy sauce to the pan and stir-fry. 4. Optionally, add vegetables like bell peppers or broccoli. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Fried Rice
Dishes.Ingredients: Cooked rice, Soy sauce, Egg, Green onions, Peas, Carrots, Garlic
Dishes.Recipe: 1. In a pan, scramble the egg and set aside. 2. Saut√© garlic, peas, carrots, and green onions. 3. Add the rice to the pan and stir-fry with soy sauce. 4. Mix in the scrambled egg and serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Spring Rolls
Dishes.Ingredients: Spring roll wrappers, Cabbage, Carrots, Bamboo shoots, Soy sauce, Ground pork (optional)
Dishes.Recipe: 1. In a pan, cook ground pork if using, then add cabbage, carrots, and bamboo shoots. 2. Add soy sauce and cook until vegetables are tender. 3. Place filling in spring roll wrappers, roll tightly, and seal. 4. Fry in oil until crispy and golden. Serve with dipping sauce.

Dishes.Name: Dumplings
Dishes.Ingredients: Dumpling wrappers, Ground pork, Ginger, Garlic, Soy sauce, Green onions
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Combine ground pork, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and green onions. 2. Place a small amount of filling in each dumpling wrapper and seal tightly. 3. Steam or boil the dumplings until cooked through. Serve with soy sauce or vinegar.

Dishes.Name: Sweet and Sour Pork
Dishes.Ingredients: Pork, Bell peppers, Pineapple, Onion, Vinegar, Sugar, Ketchup
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Cut pork into pieces and fry until crispy. 2. In a pan, mix vinegar, sugar, and ketchup to make the sweet and sour sauce. 3. Add bell peppers, onions, and pineapple to the pan and stir-fry. 4. Toss the fried pork in the sauce and serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Kung Pao Chicken
Dishes.Ingredients: Chicken, Bell peppers, Peanuts, Chili peppers, Garlic, Soy sauce, Vinegar
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Marinate chicken in soy sauce and vinegar. 2. Stir-fry chili peppers and garlic in a pan, then add chicken and cook until browned. 3. Add bell peppers and peanuts, stir-fry until everything is well combined. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Mapo Tofu
Dishes.Ingredients: Tofu, Ground pork, Garlic, Ginger, Chili bean paste, Soy sauce, Green onions
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Saut√© garlic and ginger in a pan. 2. Add ground pork and cook until browned. 3. Add chili bean paste and soy sauce, then gently fold in tofu cubes. 4. Simmer until flavors are combined. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Dishes.Name: Chow Mein
Dishes.Ingredients: Egg noodles, Bell peppers, Carrots, Green onions, Soy sauce, Garlic, Sesame oil
Dishes.Recipe: 1. Boil noodles until just tender, then drain. 2. Stir-fry garlic, bell peppers, carrots, and green onions in sesame oil. 3. Add the noodles and soy sauce to the pan, stir-frying until combined. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Moussaka
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 kg ground beef or lamb, 2 large eggplants, 3 large potatoes, 1 large onion, 3 garlic cloves, 1 cup tomato sauce, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp nutmeg, salt and pepper, 1 cup grated cheese. B√©chamel: 1/4 cup butter, 1/4 cup flour, 2 cups milk, salt, pepper, pinch of nutmeg.
Dishes.Recipe: Slice eggplants and potatoes; fry and set aside. Saut√© onion and garlic, add meat, then tomato sauce, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Simmer. For b√©chamel, melt butter, stir in flour, gradually add milk. Layer potatoes, eggplants, meat in a dish; top with b√©chamel. Bake at 180¬∞C for 30-40 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Gyros
Dishes.Ingredients: 500g pork or chicken, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp thyme, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt, pepper, 4 pita breads, sliced tomatoes, sliced onions, tzatziki sauce.
Dishes.Recipe: Marinate meat with olive oil, oregano, thyme, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Grill or pan-fry until cooked. Serve in pita bread with tomato, onion, and tzatziki sauce.

Dishes.Name: Souvlaki
Dishes.Ingredients: 500g pork or chicken cubes, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, 1 lemon (juiced), salt, pepper, wooden skewers.
Dishes.Recipe: Marinate meat with olive oil, oregano, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Skewer the meat and grill until cooked through. Serve with pita bread and tzatziki.

Dishes.Name: Greek Salad
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 cucumber, 3 tomatoes, 1 red onion, 1 green bell pepper, 100g feta cheese, 10 black olives, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, salt and pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Chop cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper. Toss with olives, olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Top with feta cheese cubes.

Dishes.Name: Tzatziki
Dishes.Ingredients: 1 cup Greek yogurt, 1 cucumber (grated), 2 garlic cloves (minced), 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp fresh dill, salt and pepper.
Dishes.Recipe: Mix grated cucumber with yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill. Season with salt and pepper. Chill before serving.

Dishes.Name: Dolmades
Dishes.Ingredients: 20 grape leaves, 1 cup rice, 1 onion (chopped), 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 lemon (juiced), salt, pepper, fresh mint, fresh dill.
Dishes.Recipe: Saut√© onion in olive oil. Mix with rice, lemon juice, salt, pepper, mint, and dill. Place a small amount on each grape leaf, roll up, and steam until rice is cooked.

Dishes.Name: Spanakopita
Dishes.Ingredients: 500g spinach, 200g feta cheese, 1 onion, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 egg, salt, pepper, phyllo pastry sheets, butter (melted).
Dishes.Recipe: Saut√© onion in olive oil, add spinach until wilted. Mix with feta, egg, salt, and pepper. Layer phyllo sheets, brushing with butter, add filling, top with more phyllo. Bake at 180¬∞C until golden.

Dishes.Name: Baklava
Dishes.Ingredients: 200g walnuts, 200g almonds, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter, 1 pack phyllo pastry, 1 cup honey, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1 tsp lemon juice.
Dishes.Recipe: Chop nuts and mix with cinnamon. Layer phyllo sheets in a pan, brushing each with butter, sprinkle nut mixture. Bake at 180¬∞C. Boil honey, sugar, water, lemon juice for syrup; pour over baklava.

Dishes.Name: Loukoumades
Dishes.Ingredients: 2 cups flour, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp yeast, 1 cup warm water, honey, cinnamon, oil for frying.
Dishes.Recipe: Mix flour, sugar, yeast, and water to make a dough; let rise. Fry spoonfuls of dough until golden. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon.
